Name:  ___                   Unit No:   ___
 
Admission Date:  ___              Discharge Date:   ___
 
Date of Birth:  ___             Sex:   M
 
Service: MEDICINE
 
Allergies: 
Bactrim
 
Attending: ___.
 
Chief Complaint:
LLE pain and agitation 
 
Major Surgical or Invasive Procedure:
n/a
 
History of Present Illness:
Mr. ___ is a ___ old man with a history of opiate use 
disorder, methamphetamine use, HIV/HCV co-infection, 
homelessness, and DVT. He was admitted to ___ from ___ to 
the MICU with septic shock from group A strep bacteremia and a 
large left lower extremity DVT likely secondary to injecting 
meth into his popliteal fossa. He was then admitted from ___ to 
___ with hypothermia and ___ bite complicated by compartment 
syndrome and rhabdomyolsysis leading to ARF requiring CRRT. He 
was treated with bilateral fasciotomies. His hospital course was 
also significant for recurrent DVT as well as hematomas while on 
heparin drip, which required placement of an IVC filter. 
Fasciotomies were all closed before discharge, and 
anticoagulation was restarted without further bleeding. 

He presented to the ED after being arrested. He was recognized 
by a police officer as having warrants and taken into custody. 
For unclear reasons, he was not accepted at the ___ 
facility where he was taken into custody and transferred to the 
ED for evaluation of his leg wounds. He remains in custody.

In the ED he complained of worsening left leg pain that has been 
progressing for the last ___ months. He has had difficulty and 
pain with use of his leg since discharge, but denied any new 
trauma. He has continued to be homeless using IV heroin and 
methamphetamine, last this morning. In the ED, he also endorsed 
suicidal ideation stating frequently that he wanted to die. He 
was evaluated by psychiatry and placed on a ___ as he was 
deemed to be an acute danger to himself.

His ED course was also notable for extreme agitation. He 
received a total of 20mg of Haldol IV, 36mg of Ativan IV, and 
440mg of ketamine IM. 

He was found to have LLE cellulitis which was treated with 
ceftazidime and vancomycin. He is admitted to ___ for airway 
monitoring given his sedating medications and treatment of his 
LLE cellulitis.

 
Past Medical History:
HIV
HCV
Opioid use disorder
DVT
HFrEF
 
Social History:
___
Family History:
Unable to obtain given altered mental status

throughout

GU / Renal: Clear urine
Extremities / MSK: Warm peripheries
Extremities/ MSK: Warm, erythematous, indurated L>R ___
Skin / Wound: Other
Skin / Wound: Linear ulcerations at prior fasciotomy sites

___ lateral fasciotomy scar with eschar, no drainage, +
surrounding erythema as well as similar sized wound on back of
calf
Neuro:  opens eyes to voice, moving all 4 extremities

IMAGING
===============
LEFT ANKLE AND TIB/FIB ___
Soft tissue defect along the upper and mid aspect of the left

tissue gas. 

BILATERAL LOWER EXTREMITY US ___
1.  Non-occlusive thrombus in the right greater saphenous vein, 
not definitely seen on the study performed in ___.  This 
is age indeterminate. 
2.  Residual non-occlusive thrombus in the left proximal, mid, 
distal 
superficial femoral veins, as well as the left popliteal vein.  
Thrombus 
burden has improved from the prior study performed in ___.

K-3.9 Cl-101 HCO3-25 AnGap-12
___ 05:10PM BLOOD Calcium-8.7 Phos-3.1 Mg-1.___RIEF HOSPITAL COURSE
================================
Mr. ___ is a ___ year old man with history of polysubstance use 
disorder (opioid, methamphetamine) c/b DVTs and septic shock in 
the past, HIV, HCV, HFrEF, overdose in ___ c/b 
exposure/hypothermia, BLE compartment syndrome s/p bilateral 
fasciotomies and hypoxic respiratory failure requiring 
intubation, now presenting via EMS after being found by police 
agitated in the setting of IV methamphetamine use and LLE pain 
c/f cellulitis. He was recognized by a police officer as having 
warrants and taken into custody. For unclear reasons, he was not 
accepted at the ___ facility where he was taken into 
custody and transferred to the ED for evaluation of his leg 
wounds. He remains in custody.

In the ED he complained of worsening left leg pain that has been 
progressing for the last ___ months. He has had difficulty and 
pain with use of his leg since discharge, but denied any new 
trauma. He has continued to be homeless using IV heroin and 
methamphetamine, last ___ morning. Patient was admitted on 
___ to the TSICU for airway watch after sedation in the ED. 
Antibiotics were started after discussion with ID (ceftz/vanc) 
and narrowed to ceftriaxone, during the course of the morning 
patient remained breathing comfortably on RA, did not require 
intubation and was found ready to be transferred to the floor. 
Patient was no longer agitated and remained somnolent during 
TSICU stay. He was transferred to medicine on ___ ___.

On the floor he was treated with antibiotics for his ___ 
cellulitis and monitored for opiate and alcohol withdrawal with 
___ police in the room. He had one blood culture positive for 
GPCs and was started on vancomycin. However, this resulted as 
CoNS and thought to be contaminant. Wound culture grew MRSA so 
was transitioned to doxy for cellulitis. His course was 
complicated by intermittent refusal of lab draws and blood 
cultures.

=========================
TRANSITIONAL ISSUES
========================
[] Extensive history of IV methamphetamine and opiate use 
disorder. Please continue to counsel patient on cessation IVDU.
[] Has known history of HIV, CD4 this admission was 212 and not 
on ARRT. Remains at risk of infection especially given he is 
undomiciled.
[] Is discharged with 5 day course of doxycycline for his left 
lower extremity cellulitis. He should start this on ___ and 
complete on ___.
[] He was found to have residual DVT as well as likely new 
superficial venous thromboembolism in his lower legs and 
discharged on Eliquis 5mg BID x 3 months. He should be monitored 
to compete this course.

On release from prison, please offer him the following 
resources:
___ for the Homeless
___
Tel ___
*
___ Emergency Services Team (BEST)
___
*
___
PAATHS (Providing Access to Addictions Treatment, Hope and
Support)
___
Walk in hours:
___, ___, ___ 7:30am- 3:30 pm
___ 7:30 - 1 pm

ACTIVE ISSUES:
==============
# LLE wounds
# LLE cellulitis
He presented with wounds on left leg both on posterior calf and 
on lateral calf in ___ fasciotomy scar site. The wounds 
appeared warm and cellulitic but without drainage or abscess. 
Plain films showed soft tissue defect but no evidence of 
osteomyelitis or tracking soft tissue gas. In the ED he was 
started on ceftaz and vanc, however ID consulted and recommended 
narrowing to CTX given prior wound cultures without growth and 
blood cx in ___ with group A strep. Orthopedics was consulted 
to assess the wounds and felt that there was no need for 
surgical intervention. Wound care was consulted and his leg was 
dressed and wrapped. One blood culture grew GPCs. There was 
concern this could have been contaminant, however given he was 
immunocompromised and with IVDU history he was treated with 
vancomycin. When cultures resulted as coag negative staph, and 
positive in only one blood culture, it was thought this was most 
likely contaminant. Wound culture grew MRSA and so he was 
transitioned from vancomycin to PO doxy for non-purulent 
cellulitis with plan for 5 days of doxycycline (end date 
___.

#AMS
Received hefty dose of ketamine and multiple doses of lorazepam 
in the ED and therefore required airway watch the ICU initially 
but was able to protect his airway and sattting well on RA. He 
had continuous oxygen monitoring on arrival to the floor. His 
AMS improved as Ativan left his system and he became alert and 
oriented.

# Elevated CK
Elevated to 650 on admission, although reassuringly with normal 
Cr so less concerned for rhabdomyolysis induced renal damage 
(which he has had in the past in the setting of compartment 
syndrome). His CK was monitored and improved with fluids.

# Agitation
# Polysubstance use disorder
Patient presented severely agitated in setting of pain from LLE 
as well as recent IV drug use. Urine tox screen positive for 
amphetamines, serum tox screen negative. Known to have last used 
IV methamphetamines on ___. On discharge in ___ was written 
for methadone 7.5mg, unclear if he has been taking but suspect 
not (he reports taking it but at unclear dose/frequency). 
Psychiatry saw him and offered suboxone or naltrexone which he 
declined.

#Opiate withdrawal
Last use was unknown, he did not have opiates in his serum tox 
screen on admission. He was monitored for signs/symptoms of 
withdrawal but did not have any withdrawal symptoms on the 
floor.

#Alcohol withdrawal
Presumed alcohol use, patient not able to further clarify use. 
Started on thiamine and MVI this admission and monitored on CIWA 
but did not score.

#History of DVT
#s/p IVC filter
Diagnosed ___, very extensive. IVC filter placed ___. On re 
ultrasound ___, DVT extended compared to prior. Decision made 
with ___ to leave IVC filter in place, given concern for 
suboptimal compliance. He was discharged after last admission 
with 5mg Eliquis BID. However, on admission notes that he does 
not take any medications. LENIS this admission revealed 
improving left lower extremity clot burden and small possibly 
new superficial right lowe rextremity clot so he was started on 
Eliquis BID. ___ was consulted regarding IVC filter and given 
possibly new clot and poor adherence with anticoagulation 
recommended leaving filter in place. Was discharged with IVC and 
anticoagulation with Eliquis 5mg BID for 3 months.

#HIV
#HCV
Not on ARRT, and hep C has not been treated. His CD4 was 212 
this admission and his HIV viral load was 5.6. Given likelihood 
of medication non-adherence on discharge, and concern that in 
this case he would be at risk of developing resistance, he was 
not started on anti retroviral therapy.

# Dispo
# Suicidal ideation
Evaluated by psychiatry in the ED and on the floor. Felt no 
indication for section 12a, especially given that he is under 
arrest and may not leave AMA. He had 24h police supervision at 
bedside. He will be discharged in police custody and brought to 
jail for arraignment.

================
CHRONIC ISSUES:
===============
# H/o HFrEF iso septic shcok
Last TTE in ___ with recovered EF to 40%. He was written for 
metoprolol on last discharge but was not taking.

#Chronic normocytic anemia
Hb 9.9 on admission, previously has been ranging ___. Hgb 
remained stable this admission.
 
Medications on Admission:
The Preadmission Medication list is accurate and complete.
1. Acetaminophen 500 mg PO Q8H 
2. Baclofen 2.5 mg PO BID 
3. FoLIC Acid 1 mg PO DAILY 
4. Gabapentin 400 mg PO TID 
5. HYDROmorphone (Dilaudid) ___ mg PO Q4H:PRN Pain - Moderate 
6. HydrOXYzine 25 mg PO QID 
7. Methadone 7.5 mg PO TID 
8. Metoprolol Tartrate 12.5 mg PO BID 
9. Pantoprazole 40 mg PO Q12H 
10. Thiamine 100 mg PO DAILY 
11. Apixaban 5 mg PO BID 

 
Discharge Medications:
1.  Doxycycline Hyclate 100 mg PO BID Duration: 5 Days 
RX *doxycycline hyclate 100 mg 1 capsule(s) by mouth twice a day 
Disp #*10 Tablet Refills:*0

Discharge Disposition:
Home
 
Discharge Diagnosis:
Lower extremity cellulitis

 
Discharge Condition:
Mental Status: Clear and coherent.
Level of Consciousness: Alert and interactive.
Activity Status: Out of Bed with assistance to chair or 
wheelchair.

 
Discharge Instructions:
Dear Mr. ___,

It was a pleasure taking care of you at the ___ 
___!  

WHY WAS I IN THE HOSPITAL?  
==========================  
-   You were in the hospital because you had a skin infection on 
your left leg.

WHAT HAPPENED IN THE HOSPITAL?  
==============================  
-  You were given antibiotics to treat your infection. You had 
x-rays that showed the infection did not extend into your bone.
- You were found to have blood clots in your legs and you were 
treated with medicine (blood thinners) for these clots.
- You were seen by the psychiatrists while you were here.

WHAT SHOULD I DO WHEN I GO HOME?  
================================  
- Please continue to take all of your medications as directed.

Thank you for allowing us to be involved in your care, we wish 
you all the best! 

Your ___ Healthcare Team  

 
Followup Instructions:
___

qafib.question: Does the note describe the patient as having permanent, paroxysmal, or persistent afib?

qprior_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having a stroke or transient ischemic attack?

qarterial_hypertension.question: Does the note describe the patient as having arterial hypertension on treatment (high bp e.g. >140, or HTN)?

qt2d.question: Does the note describe the patient as having Diabetes mellitus (DM1, DM2, T2D, T1DM, T2DM)?

qheart_failure.question: Does the note describe the patient as having heart failure?

qsurgical_valvular_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having valvular disease requiring surgery (stenosis)?

qafib_ablation.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a planned or past ablation procedure for afib?

qbleeding.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a serious bleeding in the past 6 months?

qpeptic_ulcer_disease.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having peptic ulcer disease?

qrecent_stroke.question: Does the note describe the patient as having a stroke during this admission or within the last month? (Answer yes for any recent stroke if the date is unclear)

qhemorrhagic.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever having any hemorrhagic tendencies or blood dyscrasias?

qbipolar.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with bipolar disorder?

qschizophrenia.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with schizophrenia or any schizoaffective disorders?

qmdd.question: Does the note describe the patient as ever being diagnosed with depression or major depressive disorder (MDD)?

qmed_decisions.question: Does the note describe the patient as being unable to make medical decisions? (Answer no unless there is evidence the patient cannot make their own medical decisions).

qchads2.question: What is the highest CHADS2 score mentioned? Answer "NA" if no CHADS2 score is in the note.

qblood_glucose.question: What is the highest blood glucose lab mentioned? Answer "NA" if no blood glucose score is in the note.

qlvef.question: What is the lowest left ventricular ejection (LVEF, ef, ejection fraction) fraction mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no LVEF is in the note, Answer 55 if the lowest value is 55% or greater.

qPLT.question: What is the lowest platelet count (PLT) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no platelet count is available in the note.

qHGB.question: What is the lowest hemoglobin (HGB) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no HGB value is available in the note.

qCREAT.question: What is the higest serum creatinine (Creat) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no creatinine value is available in the note.

qAST.question: What is the higest aspartate aminotransferase level (AST) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no AST value is available in the note.

qBILI.question: What is the higest total bilirubin (TotBili, Bili) mentioned in the note? Answer "NA" if no bilirubin value is available in the note.
